author: John Ruskin

author: Marc Benioff

title: Creativity comes from trust. Trust your instincts. And never hope more than you work.
author: Rita Mae Brown

title: Mother Earth needs us to keep our covenant. We will do this in courts, we will do this on our radio station, and we will commit to our descendants to work hard to protect this land and water for them. Whether you have feet, wings, fins, or roots, we are all in it together.
author: Winona LaDuke

title: There are already dozens of organizations working on trying to prevent plastic from going into the ocean, through advocacy, education, awareness, all great work, yet nobody was addressing the stock of existing pollution.
author: Boyan Slat

title: There's only one growth strategy: work hard.
author: William Hague

title: There is a computer disease that anybody who works with computers knows about. It's a very serious disease and it interferes completely with the work. The trouble with computers is that you 'play' with them!
author: Richard P. Feynman

title: No man will work for your interests unless they are his.
author: David Seabury

title: When you join a political party, you are attaching yourself with an organisation of skilled people. And when you work with an organisation, your working capacity becomes double. One can perform better with the help of an organisation to implement their thoughts.
author: Govinda

title: No one can predict the future, but what I do know is that myself and my team work hard every day to make sure that my vision, my sound, and my brand reach their full potential.
author: Justine Skye

title: I don't rely on feng shui. I believe hard work brings us good luck and success.
author: John Gokongwei

title: A little less complaint and whining, and a little more dogged work and manly striving, would do us more credit than a thousand civil rights bills.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

title: Go ahead, work hard and never be afraid to try something. Even if you don't make it, at least you can say you tried.
author: Guy Lafleur

title: I couldn't be more proud of my work as a progressive.
author: Christine Quinn

title: I think I've realized that when you are aiming to create a real body of work, you are as much defined by the things you don't do as by the things you do.
author: Tessa Thompson

title: Hope is favorable and confident expectation; it's an expectant attitude that something good is going to happen and things will work out, no matter what situation we're facing.
author: Joyce Meyer

title: In Italy, they add work and life on to food and wine.
author: Robin Leach

title: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
author: Aristotle

title: I enjoy the celebration of my birthday as much as anyone else does, but I always remember to start my day thanking my mom because she did most of the work the day I came into the world, not to mention all she has done throughout my life that has contributed so much to the woman I am today.
author: Christy Turlington

title: I've got more in common with a three-toed sloth than I have with Winston Churchill. There is no easy comparison with any modern politician. The more you read about him, the more completely amazed you are about what he did - his energy, his literary fecundity, his ability to work - just unbelievable energy.
author: Boris Johnson

title: I have many aspects of my game I need to improve, and that's what I am focusing on. I prefer not to say what they are in public - for me, it's a secret, and I just want to work hard.
author: Anthony Martial

title: My dreams for the future are simple: work, a happy, healthy family, a lovely long motorcycle ride, and continuing the struggle to awaken people to the need for serious human rights reform.
author: Mike Farrell

title: When I was young, I wanted to be a writer or painter. I was always writing stories, and I excelled at drawing. My teachers encouraged my art work. When I was 9 or 10, I began learning piano and started writing music.
author: Bat for Lashes

title: It doesn't matter how hard you work, there are forces that kind of prevent you from being the best you can be.
author: Shahid Khan

title: You learn to speak by speaking, to study by studying, to run by running, to work by working; in just the same way, you learn to love by loving.
author: Anatole France

title: Put your head down and work as hard as you can because there is always someone better out there.
author: Brian McBride

title: Don't worry about being a star, worry about doing good work, and all that will come to you.
author: Ice Cube

title: You have to work very hard behind the scenes, to make a message clear enough for a lot of people to understand.
author: Stefano Gabbana

title: I'm just an individual who doesn't feel that I need to have somebody qualify my work in any particular way. I'm working for me.
author: David Bowie

title: Don't work for recognition, but do work worthy of recognition.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

title: A race is a work of art that people can look at and be affected in as many ways they're capable of understanding.
author: Steve Prefontaine

title: For since the fabric of the universe is most perfect and the work of a most wise Creator, nothing at all takes place in the universe in which some rule of maximum or minimum does not appear.
author: Leonhard Euler

title: It is not sufficient to see and to know the beauty of a work. We must feel and be affected by it.
author: Voltaire

title: In 1964, when Lee Iacocca said, 'Shelby, I want you to make a sports car out of the Mustang,' the first thing I said was, 'Lee, you can't make a race horse out of a mule. I don't want to do it.' He said, 'I didn't ask you to make it; you work for me.'
author: Carroll Shelby

title: Email, instant messaging, and cell phones give us fabulous communication ability, but because we live and work in our own little worlds, that communication is totally disorganized.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

title: I was born in a very poor family. I used to sell tea in a railway coach as a child. My mother used to wash utensils and do lowly household work in the houses of others to earn a livelihood. I have seen poverty very closely. I have lived in poverty. As a child, my entire childhood was steeped in poverty.
author: Narendra Modi

title: Justice must always question itself, just as society can exist only by means of the work it does on itself and on its institutions.
author: Michel Foucault

title: Begin - to begin is half the work, let half still remain; again begin this, and thou wilt have finished.
author: Marcus Aurelius

title: It takes a lot of energy to be negative. You have to work at it. But smiling is painless. I'd rather spend my energy smiling.
author: Eric Davis

title: You see, God helps only people who work hard. That principle is very clear.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

title: If this work seems so threatening, this is because it isn't simply eccentric or strange, but competent, rigorously argued, and carrying conviction.
author: Jacques Derrida

title: But quality of work can be expected only through personal satisfaction, dedication and enjoyment. In our profession, precision and perfection are not a dispensible luxury, but a simple necessity.
author: Niklaus Wirth

title: Where the spirit does not work with the hand, there is no art.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

title: Because 'Gob' was a terrible magician, he was always, in great comedic moments, messing up his magic act. We used to have magicians come in to work on these tricks to actually get them wrong. But they still had to work. We had to bring magicians on to make magic not work.
author: Will Arnett

title: The work of anti-racism can only take place inside each individual soul, where we all try to grow into better people. There is no national tonic or instant cure.
author: Joy Reid

title: Diplomacy is listening to what the other guy needs. Preserving your own position, but listening to the other guy. You have to develop relationships with other people so when the tough times come, you can work together.
author: Colin Powell

title: Lazy people tend not to take chances, but express themselves by tearing down other's work.
author: Ann Rule

title: When I used to teach yoga in Bangalore and Mumbai, I noticed many clients struggling to cope with their weight. During some days, they would come in with plans to work out harder than usual because of events they'd have to attend later that week. The insecurity of appearance is something everyone goes through... even I.
author: Anushka Shetty

title: The beginning of a friendship, the fact that two people out of the thousands around them can meet and connect and become friends, seems like a kind of magic to me. But maintaining a friendship requires work. I don't mean that as a bad thing. Good art requires work as well.
author: Charles de Lint

title: If you want small changes in your life, work on your attitude. But if you want big and primary changes, work on your paradigm.
author: Stephen Covey

title: I'm overly confident. I believe in myself 100 percent. I believe in my game, and I believe in my work ethic.
author: Jaylen Brown

title: Surround yourself with people you can always learn something from. Always work with people that are better at their craft than you are.
author: Tony Vincent
